answers.answer: I have been scheduled for induction at 39 weeks 2 days...due to GD. I am hoping to have this baby at 38 weeks tho because I really hate the idea if being induced!!!! Good luck, as far as I know they don't schedule it super early...just a week ot less!

They usually won't until your 38 weeks. Even then your doctor has to submit papers to the hospital and they have to approve it. If it's blood pressure they usually don't deny it. If it's gd they may be very picky unless your doc can prove enough. Some new laws that hospitals have to follow.
It will be at around 39 weeks unless there is distress for the baby or u don't have enough fluid or u r having some type of medical problem that may put u or the baby in danger

36weeks is full term. However the babies develop at different rates. As long as your baby is 5lbs, breathing on its own and able to suck it will go home. Induction has to be medical reason or in an area that allows elective early dates.

My induction was because my cervix doesn't open (3kids later I can hold them forever). I got there super early in th morning, signing the baby release papers, within 2 hrs got my epidural then had surgery, recovery time was boring because everybody was with my baby but my csection didn't bother me. Vaginal birth I couldn't walk my lady parts were swollen
They have me schedule to b done as soon a my baby hits 37 weeks due to diabetes. But today they said i might not make it to then

Here in the states GD is a serious complication where i have heard of several friends of mine being induced before then bc the risk is to high with gd. Just try not to stress and keep your sugar as controlled as possible.
Thanks Ladies, I'll hopefully find out more at my scan... :) x

question: I have been told I will be induced early or have an early c section due to Gestational Diabetes and the fact my baby is measuring a lot bigger than average. I'm 34 weeks atm and a little confused about how early they mean. I don't see my midwife again until I'm 36 weeks, has anyone been taken early due to diabetes?What was your experience?  I feel like everything is a little up in the air atm.
title: Early induction
